Well, I guess you could amend accessor with the pointer traits.
I've used this new header CUDATensorAccessor.cuh: https://github.com/t-vi/pytorch/blob/cuda_tensoraccessor/aten/src/ATen/cuda/CUDATensorAccessor.cuh
for a module of mine and it seemed to work, but it is far from a PR.

  • I would prefer to have a tensor method, but I'm not 100% certain where I can put it,
  • I would want to have some unit tests (just writing some arange-like array in a kernel), but again I'm not 100% certain where to put them.

Well, I guess you could amend accessor with the pointer traits.
I've used this new header CUDATensorAccessor.cuh: https://github.com/t-vi/pytorch/blob/cuda_tensoraccessor/aten/src/ATen/cuda/CUDATensorAccessor.cuh
for a module of mine and it seemed to work, but it is far from a PR.
- I would prefer to have a tensor method, but I'm not 100% certain where I can put it,
- I would want to have some unit tests (just writing some arange-like array in a kernel), but again I'm not 100% certain where to put them.
